2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Princess of Wales.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Princess of Wales is a good shout.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Does anyone know if The Red Lion has a good view of the game?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales has the best screen, hands down. We're going there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Is anyone else up for watching the Andorra versus Portugal game at The Princess of Wales?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales it is, then!"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. All of William Jones's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, William Jones had a great time watching the game!
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good choice for watching a game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "What about The Red Lion? They have a good view of the screen.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs, particularly with friends like Alexander White and Jacob Walker. They are a dedicated fan and will attend games regardless of who else is present.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Princess of Wales, or he could go to The Red Lion.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Princess of Wales.

          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with his friends, Alexander White and Jacob Walker. He is a dedicated fan and will attend games regardless of who else is present.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with his friends, Alexander White and Jacob Walker. He is a dedicated fan and will attend games regardless of who else is present.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Answer: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.

          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs, particularly with friends like Alexander White and Jacob Walker. They are a dedicated fan and will attend games regardless of who else is present.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Princess of Wales, or he could go to The Red Lion.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "I'm hoping we can find a pub with a good atmosphere for the game.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "I'm hoping we can find a pub with a good atmosphere for the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Does anyone know if The Red Lion has a good view of the game?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales has the best screen, hands down. We're going there.
      Jack Taylor -- "Is anyone else up for watching the Andorra versus Portugal game at The Princess of Wales?
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Princess of Wales is a good shout.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales it is, then!"
      Alice Lewis -- "What about The Red Lion? They have a good view of the screen.
      William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good choice for watching a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "I'm hoping we can find a pub with a good atmosphere for the game.

He is easygoing and adaptable, as shown by his acceptance of Jacob Walker's potential absence. While he had an "ok" time watching a game at The Princess of Wales on May 15th, 2015, at 6:00 PM, he would have preferred more friends to be there. On May 16th, 2015, at 10:00 AM, Alexander White joined William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker at a market, enjoying the atmosphere. Later that day, the group plans to watch the Moldova versus Monaco game at a yet-to-be-decided pub.

Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football in pubs.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "I'm hoping we can find a pub with a good atmosphere for the game.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking truth bomb, their cynicism a sharp scalpel that dissects BS and cuts straight to the heart of the matter.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Princess of Wales and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football in pubs.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is currently with friends at a market and will be watching a soccer game later tonight.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying a social outing with friends at a market.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be engaged in conversation with his friends, enjoying the atmosphere and perhaps sampling the local treats.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "Anyone up for a pastry? These croissants look incredible.

        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for games.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Does anyone know if The Red Lion has a good view of the game?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales has the best screen, hands down. We're going there.
      Jack Taylor -- "Is anyone else up for watching the Andorra versus Portugal game at The Princess of Wales?
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Princess of Wales is a good shout.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales it is, then!"
      Alice Lewis -- "What about The Red Lion? They have a good view of the screen.
      William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good choice for watching a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "I'm hoping we can find a pub with a good atmosphere for the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "Anyone up for a pastry? These croissants look incredible.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for games.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for games.
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Princess of Wales.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Princess of Wales is a good shout.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales it is, then!"
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. All of William Jones's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, William Jones had a great time watching the game!
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. All of William Jones's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, William Jones had a great time watching the game!
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Anyone up for a pastry? These croissants look incredible.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "I heard The Princess of Wales is a good spot for the game.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "I heard The Princess of Wales is a good spot for the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Does anyone know if The Red Lion has a good view of the game?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales has the best screen, hands down. We're going there.
      Jack Taylor -- "Is anyone else up for watching the Andorra versus Portugal game at The Princess of Wales?
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Princess of Wales is a good shout.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales it is, then!"
      Alice Lewis -- "What about The Red Lion? They have a good view of the screen.
      William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good choice for watching a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "I'm hoping we can find a pub with a good atmosphere for the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "Anyone up for a pastry? These croissants look incredible.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for games.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "I heard The Princess of Wales is a good spot for the game.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "I hear The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "I hear The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Does anyone know if The Red Lion has a good view of the game?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales has the best screen, hands down. We're going there.
      Jack Taylor -- "Is anyone else up for watching the Andorra versus Portugal game at The Princess of Wales?
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Princess of Wales is a good shout.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales it is, then!"
      Alice Lewis -- "What about The Red Lion? They have a good view of the screen.
      William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good choice for watching a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "I'm hoping we can find a pub with a good atmosphere for the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "Anyone up for a pastry? These croissants look incredible.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for games.
      Jack Taylor -- "I heard The Princess of Wales is a good spot for the game.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    William Jones -- premise: Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
    William Jones -- premise: It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Anyone up for a pastry? These croissants look incredible.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football in pubs.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "I'm hoping we can find a pub with a good atmosphere for the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be engaged in conversation with his friends, enjoying the atmosphere and perhaps sampling the local treats.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for games.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football in pubs.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value

          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is eager to meet his friends.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is excited to watch a game at the pub with his friends, especially William Jones and Alice Lewis. He would also welcome Jack Taylor's company.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt

        • Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking truth bomb, their cynicism a sharp scalpel that dissects BS and cuts straight to the heart of the matter.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Princess of Wales and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football in pubs.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch a game at the pub with his friends, especially William Jones and Alice Lewis. He would also welcome Jack Taylor's company.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be excited to meet up with his friends and enjoy the game in a lively atmosphere.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Princess of Wales

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to text his friends and suggest meeting at The Princess of Wales.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good choice for watching a game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "What about The Red Lion? They have a good view of the screen.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. All of William Jones's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, William Jones had a great time watching the game!
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "I heard The Princess of Wales is a good spot for the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for games.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "I hear The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly The Princess of Wales, and values the company of Alexander White, Jacob Walker, and Alice Lewis.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could text his friends to coordinate meeting at The Princess of Wales.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to text his friends and suggest meeting at The Princess of Wales.

These croissants look incredible.', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly The Princess of Wales, and values the company of Alexander White, Jacob Walker, and Alice Lewis.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, Alexander White, Jacob Walker, and Alice Lewis, at pubs like The Princess of Wales.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, Alexander White, Jacob Walker, and Alice Lewis, at pubs like The Princess of Wales.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and traditional pub with a roaring fireplace, perfect for escaping the cold.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Princess of Wales is a good shout.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales.           [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could text his friends to coordinate meeting at The Princess of Wales.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to text his friends and suggest meeting at The Princess of Wales.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (a)

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Does anyone know if The Red Lion has a good view of the game?
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Does anyone know if The Red Lion has a good view of the game?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "Does anyone know if The Red Lion has a good view of the game?

          Recent Observations:
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she watched from the sidelines as Jack Taylor effortlessly scored the winning goal in the school football match. A wave of envy washed over her, a bitter cocktail of admiration and resentment, as the crowd erupted in cheers for her best friend. She longed to be the one basking in the spotlight, but her fear of failure kept her rooted to the spot, a spectator in her own life.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The staff are dog lovers themselves and always happy to see furry friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

    Event statement

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking truth bomb, their cynicism a sharp scalpel that dissects BS and cuts straight to the heart of the matter.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Princess of Wales and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual with a penchant for both mischief and camaraderie.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and is planning to watch a soccer game later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation or lighthearted banter.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales has the best screen, hands down. We're going there.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Is anyone else up for watching the Andorra versus Portugal game at The Princess of Wales?
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Is anyone else up for watching the Andorra versus Portugal game at The Princess of Wales?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Does anyone know if The Red Lion has a good view of the game?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales has the best screen, hands down. We're going there.

          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he meticulously tracked every point scored in a basketball game between his team and their rivals. Despite his team winning, William fixated on a single missed free throw by Jack Taylor, convinced it cost them a larger margin of victory. He spent the next week pointedly reminding Jack of the mistake, relishing the flicker of annoyance in his friend's eyes.

Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]

He spent the next week pointedly reminding Jack of the mistake, relishing the flicker of annoyance in his friend's eyes.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales it is, then!"
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales it is, then!"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Does anyone know if The Red Lion has a good view of the game?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales has the best screen, hands down. We're going there.
      Jack Taylor -- "Is anyone else up for watching the Andorra versus Portugal game at The Princess of Wales?
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Princess of Wales is a good shout.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    William Jones -- premise: While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
    Alexander White -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good choice for watching a game.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good choice for watching a game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Does anyone know if The Red Lion has a good view of the game?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales has the best screen, hands down. We're going there.
      Jack Taylor -- "Is anyone else up for watching the Andorra versus Portugal game at The Princess of Wales?
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Princess of Wales is a good shout.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales it is, then!"
      Alice Lewis -- "What about The Red Lion? They have a good view of the screen.

    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good choice for watching a game.
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Princess of Wales.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and traditional pub with a roaring fireplace, perfect for escaping the cold.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales has the best screen, hands down. We're going there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Is anyone else up for watching the Andorra versus Portugal game at The Princess of Wales?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales it is, then!"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Does anyone know if The Red Lion has a good view of the game?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Princess of Wales is a good shout.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. All of William Jones's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, William Jones had a great time watching the game!
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "What about The Red Lion? They have a good view of the screen.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
